item.title: 人工智能会计初创企业Basis估值达11.5亿美元
item.description: 人工智能会计初创企业Basis凭借新一轮融资跻身独角兽行列，人工智能技术的进步正撼动金融服务市场格局。【原文：AI-for-accounting startup Basis has surged to unicorn status with a new funding round as advances in artificial intelligence rattle the financial services markets.】

item.title: 特朗普为美国经济背书，尽管经济尚未完全复苏
item.description: 总统将在周二向国会发表的国情咨文演讲中，着力宣传本国经济取得的成就。【原文：The president will aim to sell a message of economic success in his state-of-the-union speech Tuesday before Congress.】

item.title: 特朗普暗示企业申请关税退税将面临漫长艰难的斗争
item.description: 贝森特将关税返利称为"企业福利"，而国会对此兴趣寥寥【原文：Bessent spins tariff returns as ‘corporate welfare’ while Congress shows little interest】

item.title: JDE Peet’s助力KDP业绩增长，2026年展望乐观
item.description: Keurig Dr Pepper公司对全年销售额作出乐观预测，称其计划于2026年下半年收购荷兰咖啡制造商JDE Peet's NV，此举将为公司业绩带来提振。【原文：Keurig Dr Pepper Inc. offered an upbeat forecast for its full-year sales, saying it expected a boost from its planned purchase of Dutch coffee maker JDE Peet’s NV later in 2026.】

item.title: 萨克斯全球首席执行官称顶级品牌破产后仍在发货
item.description: 萨克斯全球企业表示，包括博柏利以及奢侈品巨头路威酩轩集团和开云集团旗下品牌在内的数百个品牌，已恢复或继续向这家陷入困境的零售商供货，该公司正试图摆脱破产困境。【原文：Saks Global Enterprises said hundreds of brands, including Burberry and those owned by luxury powerhouses LVMH and Kering, have either resumed or continued shipping to the troubled retailer as it tries to emerge from bankruptcy.】

item.title: Meta将斥资数十亿美元收购AMD设备并购入股票
item.description: Meta Platforms公司将部署基于AMD处理器的6吉瓦级数据中心设备，这项重磅交易标志着这家芯片制造商在追赶英伟达公司方面取得重大进展。【原文：Meta Platforms Inc. will deploy 6 gigawatts’ worth of data center gear based on processors from Advanced Micro Devices Inc., a blockbuster deal that marks a win for the chipmaker’s attempts to catch up with Nvidia Corp.】

item.title: 美国国债涨幅收窄，关键收益率徘徊在4%附近
item.description: 美国国债持稳，因避险需求减弱，投资者将关注点转向债券的短期风险。【原文：US Treasuries steadied as demand for havens eased and investors focused on the near-term risks for bonds.】

item.title: 瑞士债券市场瞄准爆发式销售，得益于谷歌母公司Alphabet的首次公开募股
item.description: 今年瑞士法郎计价的企业债券发行规模可能突破250亿，远超市场常规水平。若这种避险货币的低利率吸引更多国际借款人效仿谷歌母公司Alphabet Inc.进入市场，这一数字或将进一步攀升。【原文：Corporate bond sales in Swiss francs could top 25 billion this year, far beyond the market’s normal volumes if the haven currency’s low interest rates spur more international borrowers to follow Google parent Alphabet Inc. in to the market.】

item.title: 德意志银行首席投资官称中国吸引力增强，资金流入持续增长
item.description: 德意志银行私人银行全球首席投资官克里斯蒂安·诺尔廷表示，中国的科技实力正使该国成为越来越有吸引力的投资目的地。【原文：China’s tech prowess is making the country an increasingly attractive investment destination, according to Christian Nolting, Deutsche Bank AG’s global chief investment officer for private banking.】

item.title: 安培体育股价下跌，因前景黯淡引发成本担忧
item.description: 安培体育公司股价下跌，此前该公司发布的第一季度业绩展望低于预期，市场担忧其推广萨洛蒙鞋类和始祖鸟服装品牌将导致成本上升。【原文：Amer Sports Inc. shares fell after the company issued a first-quarter outlook that trailed expectations, raising concerns on higher costs to promote its Salomon footwear and Arc’teryx apparel brands.】

item.title: 欧洲银行告知欧洲央行，它们将从人工智能中获益
item.description: 欧洲央行一位高官表示，随着人工智能颠覆其商业模式，该地区贷款机构有望从中获益。【原文：A top European Central Bank official said lenders from the region expect to benefit as artificial intelligence shakes up their business models.】

item.title: 美银称美国可增售国库券弥补关税收入损失
item.description: 据纽约银行策略师称，在最高法院推翻特朗普总统的关税政策后，美国可能发行更多短期票据以弥补税收损失。【原文：The US is likely to issue more short-dated notes to make up for lost revenues after the Supreme Court overturned President Donald Trump’s tariffs, according to a BNY strategist.】

item.title: 火灾与停电导致开普敦机场运营中断
item.description: 周二，一场火灾和停电事故导致开普敦国际机场运营中断，造成航班延误，并暂停了南非主要旅游枢纽门户的国际航班。【原文：A fire and a power outage disrupted operations at Cape Town International Airport on Tuesday, leading to delays and the suspension of international flights at the gateway to South Africa’s main tourism hub.】

item.description:
随着投资者逃离人工智能带来的颠覆性影响，一篮子资本密集型股票正强势反弹。

【原文：

A basket of capital-intensive stocks is rallying as investors flee AI disruption.

item.title: 塔塔推迟董事长连任投票，权力角逐显露端倪
item.description: 知情人士透露，塔塔集团董事会推迟了关于是否批准董事长纳塔拉詹·钱德拉塞卡兰连任第三届的决定。这最新动向表明，这家印度最古老的综合企业集团可能正酝酿新一轮领导权之争。【原文：The board of Tata Sons Pvt. deferred a decision on granting a third term to Chairman Natarajan Chandrasekaran, people familiar said, in the latest sign that another leadership tussle could be brewing at India’s oldest conglomerate.】

item.title: 美国紫薯热潮正挤压菲律宾供应链
item.description:
紫薯作为菲律宾菜肴的经典食材，如今已遍布全球菜单，而农民们正竭力满足市场需求。

【原文：

Long a staple of Filipino cuisine, the purple yam is all over global menus, and farmers are struggling to keep up.

】

item.title: 肉类零食制造商Archer获1亿美元贷款，女性消费者需求持续增长
item.description: 阿彻肉类零食公司从摩根大通公司获得了近1亿美元的信贷额度，这使其能够在高蛋白零食需求激增之际扩大生产——尤其受到女性消费者的青睐。【原文：Archer Meat Snacks secured a credit facility for nearly $100 million from JPMorgan Chase & Co., allowing it to ramp up production as demand surges for its high-protein snacks — particularly among women.】

item.title: 埃克森美孚力推圭亚那增长，角逐下个十年的油田
item.description: 埃克森美孚公司正押注其在圭亚那的重大发现所引发的经济繁荣，将使公司在与其他寻求开发本国油气储备的国家谈判财政条款时占据优势。【原文：Exxon Mobil Corp. is betting the economic boom unleashed by its giant discovery in Guyana will give the company an edge when negotiating fiscal terms with other nations looking to develop their own oil and gas reserves.】

item.title: 苹果将推出美国制造的Mac mini，作为特朗普政府推动消费计划的一部分
item.description: 苹果公司周二宣布，将于今年晚些时候在休斯顿启动Mac mini台式电脑的生产，此举是该公司推动在美国增加制造业产量的举措之一。【原文：Apple Inc. on Tuesday said it will start building Mac mini desktop computers in Houston later this year, part of a push to do more manufacturing in the US.】

item.title: 贝莱德领投荷兰芯片制造商Axelera AI 2.5亿美元融资轮
item.description: 荷兰芯片制造商Axelera AI从包括贝莱德公司在内的投资者处筹集了超过2.5亿美元资金，用于开发高效能半导体芯片。这些芯片专为运行经过训练的人工智能模型而设计。【原文：Dutch chipmaker Axelera AI raised more than $250 million from investors including BlackRock Inc. to make power-efficient semiconductors that are designed to run artificial intelligence models after they’ve been trained.】

item.title: 特朗普宣称经济成就归功于自己，但要向民众推销这一成果面临艰巨任务
item.description: 唐纳德·特朗普宣称美国经济终于属于他了。现在他必须捍卫它。【原文：Donald Trump says the US economy is finally his. Now he’ll have to defend it.】

item.title: 前道明银行交易员纳达拉贾在等待虚假报价审判期间被禁业
item.description: 多伦多道明银行和杰富瑞金融集团前高级交易员因涉嫌操纵美国国债市场而面临审判，在此期间被禁止在美国金融业从业。【原文：A former senior trader at Toronto-Dominion Bank and Jefferies Financial Group Inc. was banned from the US financial industry while he awaits trial over charges that he allegedly manipulated the market for US government bonds.】

item.title: 投资者正抛售软件股，盈利也无法阻止这一趋势
item.description: 投资者数月来持续抛售软件类股票，因担忧人工智能带来的颠覆性影响，而该板块即将公布的财报预计也难以平息市场焦虑。【原文：Investors have been ditching software stocks for months on fears of disruption from artificial intelligence, and upcoming earnings from the group aren’t expected to settle any nerves.】

item.title: 印度金达尔集团筹措10亿美元贷款以提振低迷市场
item.description: 知情人士透露，印度最大企业集团之一金达尔集团的能源部门正寻求通过离岸贷款筹集高达10亿美元资金，用于海外扩张。此举为受贸易波动困扰的印度美元贷款市场带来喘息之机。【原文：The power unit of one of India’s largest conglomerates Jindal Group is seeking to raise as much as $1 billion from offshore loans to fund overseas expansion, according to people familiar with the matter, providing relief for India’s dollar loan market that’s been stymied by trade swings.】

item.title: CECO Environmental即将达成22亿美元收购Thermon的交易
item.description: 知情人士透露，CECO Environmental Corp.正就收购Thermon Group Holdings Inc.进行深入谈判。随着数据中心对热管理解决方案的需求激增，这家过滤设备制造商正寻求进军该领域。【原文：CECO Environmental Corp. is in advanced talks to acquire Thermon Group Holdings Inc., as the filtration company looks to enter the thermal solutions market amid booming demand from data centers, people familiar with the situation said.】

item.title: 库存持续减少的看涨者在悲观情绪升温中看到希望的曙光
item.description: 近四个月来，美国股市始终在历史高位附近震荡，几乎每次上涨都迅速被抛售浪潮抹去，本周一的行情便是如此。【原文：US stocks have churned near a record for nearly four months, with virtually every gain quickly wiped out by a bout of selling like Monday’s.】

item.title: 中国美格科技以地缘政治为由剥离美国子公司
item.description: 中国生物技术公司美格纳科技宣布将剥离其全资美国子公司Complete Genomics Inc，结束长达十年的美国市场扩张计划。该公司称此举是因美国政策环境日益严峻。【原文：Chinese biotechnology firm MGI Tech Co. announced it will divest its wholly-owned US subsidiary, Complete Genomics Inc, retreating from a decade-long quest to expand in the American market amid what it described as an increasingly grim policy environment.】
